definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards

sentences.english: At the Vanity Fair party, they were let in the back door.
sentences.chinese: 在《名利场》杂志的聚会上，他们从后门进来。

sentences.english: I neither complain for lacking money nor hostile to riches and honour.
sentences.chinese: 淡薄名利，宁静致远，既不抱怨贫贱又不仇视富贵。

sentences.english: A truly charitable person will perform charitable deeds without the thought of getting name or rewards.
sentences.chinese: 真正布施行善的人不要名利，也不求福报。

sentences.english: Mr. White have uncontrollable greed for fame and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生毫无忌惮地贪求名利。

sentences.english: At that moment I become widely known, not for fame and gain, but meet you again.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻我万众瞩目，不为名利，只为再见你的容颜。

sentences.english: Criticize the ideology of going after fame and wealth.
Keep off fame and wealth; crave not external attractions. Always see life as a candle flickering in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 勿涉足名利，勿贪恋外境，时刻视生命如风中之烛。

sentences.english: He is indifferent to fame and gain, and never cares about them.
sentences.chinese: 对于世俗名利，他总是漠然置之，不放在心上。

sentences.english: They all say she is stepping on her road to fames and fortunes.
sentences.chinese: 大家都说她正走上名利双收的路上。

sentences.english: It soon became a refuge from the fame he increasingly eschewed.
sentences.chinese: 很快这里变成了他逐渐远离名利的避难所。

sentences.english: Which career will ensure both fame and wealth for you?
sentences.chinese: 哪种职业可确保你名利双收？

sentences.english: When one is insincere, one is selfish and seeks after fame and profit.
sentences.chinese: 意念不诚，也就是有个自私心和名利心。

sentences.english: Most people seemed to have rebel attitudes and social-climbing attitudes all scrambled together.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人似乎将反叛和追逐名利的态度糅杂在了一起。

sentences.english: After be released from prison, turn and careerism, aspire stand out.
sentences.chinese: 出狱后，转而追求名利，立志出人头地。

sentences.english: The talent of success is nothing more than doing well whatever you do without a thought of fame. ----H. W. Longfellow.
sentences.chinese: 成功的天才只是做好自己所做的事，而不计名利罢了。

sentences.english: If I really want to seek the fame and interest, I attain them sooner without your theories.
sentences.chinese: 真想求名利，还是不信你们那套来的快些。

definition: position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
mere worldly, superficial gain, such as wealth and fame
lit. fettered by fame and locked up by riches (idiom); tied down by reputation and wealth/the victim of one's own success
